docs.lead_paragraph: In its campaign against birth defects, the March of Dimes has focused its energies on mothers-to-be. Now it is taking a hard look at the other factor in the baby equation. "Men have babies, too" is the slogan of a new campaign to help men realize that their living habits and occupational and recreational exposures could harm their children. Men are now being urged to consider how substances they deliberately or inadvertently take into their bodies may affect their sperm and alter the outcome of their partner's pregnancies.
